meanings.definition: To remove the trimmings or adornments from something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully untrims the Christmas tree, taking off all the decorations.
meanings.sent2: The tailor untrims the excess fabric to make the dress fit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: After the party, she untrims the fancy table setting, returning everything to its original state.
meanings.sent4: The artist untrims the painting, stripping away the unnecessary details to reveal its true beauty.
meanings.sent5: He untrims the hedge, shaping it into a neat and tidy form.

meanings.definition: Not trimmed or neat in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The untrims edges of the paper gave it a rugged look.
meanings.sent2: Her untrims hair flowed freely in the wind, untamed and wild.
meanings.sent3: The untrims garden had a charmingly messy appeal, with flowers growing in all directions.
meanings.sent4: The untrims bushes in the yard created a sense of natural beauty, untouched by human hands.
meanings.sent5: The untrims jacket gave him a casual, laid-back appearance.
